formattedAddress: 10 Riverside Blvd, New York, NY 10069, USA
adrFormatAddress: 10 Riverside Blvd, New York, NY 10069, USA

originalText.text:
Commendable Concept. Three seperate buildings that become one community by way of the Waterline Club in the center...incredible unprecedented amenities. The apartments are spacious with ample closets. Very comfortable layouts. The construction materials, fixtures and countertops
however, are below par. Poor sound insulation between units.heap materials and no sound insulation whatsoever between units.
That aside, Waterline Square offers a wonderfully peaceful retreat from the hurried hustle of NYC life with everything you need at your fingertips.  It's worth a look !

originalText.text: If I could give NO STARS I would, I have worked for this company (LIVunLtd) for years, I worked in The Waterline Club. To begin with I saw a gender pay gap with my fellow co-worker from the beginning, management doesn't know how to manage people nor issues between coworkers, they are not flexible at all with work hours. I have seen amazing people leave the company and I have seen many people get away with basically murder if they could due to favoritism. Also after I got fired, my own boss was degrading my work ethic to other co-workers and members. NOT PROFESSIONAL AT ALL!

originalText.text:
Cool mini-Park in a quiet neighborhood.

Stumbled into this park by chance last summer and what a pleasant delight!

Greenery, flowing water + fountains, and flowers adorn an otherwise forgettable area at the water’s edge. And the park blends in perfectly with the surrounding glass condos.

Always nice to see creativity in city planning. I suspect this will become a local treasure flying under the radar in the coming years.

originalText.text: My rating relates only to the park area. It’s a lovely place for families & kids & we enjoy coming in summer v much. However - I agree with Yvette below re the dog problem. Despite numerous signs (which to be fair aren’t super clear) many people bring dogs - often unleashed - onto Astro turf & even in the kids’ splash areas! Common sense should tell these irresponsible owners that it’s a health & safety risk. Sadly I’ve had numerous encounters requesting they remove their dogs or leash them. Yesterday I called 311 but was told it’s a private development. So Waterline Square owners - PLEASE patrol it! Dog presence is ruining this otherwise great little area. Thank you!

originalText.text: Gorgeous 100,000 sq amenities,  units and outdoor space.  Our leasing agent Ari, is hands down the best. An expremley knowledgeable, kind, caring who knows the neighborhood,  three builings amenities and units inside and out. Listens and advices the best option that will meet your needs. It would be an honor for us to be tenants. Thank you Ari for your hard work. It show how much he loves his job and cares for his applicants.
